snippet: As plows cleared the way and buses with chains clanked down glazed streets, it seemed that the New York region had been spared the worst.
abstract: New York City is hit by substantial, but not overwhelming, snowstorm that closes schools and highways, strands travelers and disrupts operations across Northeast; storm is remarkable for very cold temperatures that follow it.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Jess Bidgood, Michael M. Grynbaum, Andy Newman, Michael Schwirtz and Julie Turkewitz.

lead_paragraph: As plows cleared the way and buses with chains clanked down glazed streets, it seemed that the New York region had been spared the worst.

headline.main: Storm Slams East Coast, Leaving a Trail of Havoc
headline.print_headline: A Snowstorm Hits the East Coast, Plunging the Region Into a Deep Freeze
